title: Quinten Lawrence
text:
Quinten Louis Lawrence (born September 21, 1984) is a former <a href="gridiron%20football">gridiron football</a> <a href="defensive%20back">defensive back</a>. He was drafted by the <a href="Kansas%20City%20Chiefs">Kansas City Chiefs</a> in the sixth round of the <a href="2009%20NFL%20Draft">2009 NFL Draft</a>. He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="McNeese%20State%20University%23Athletics">McNeese State</a>.
Early years.
Lawrence attended <a href="Carencro%20High%20School">Carencro High School</a> in <a href="Carencro%2C%20Louisiana">Carencro, Louisiana</a> and was a student and a <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">letterman</a> in <a href="High%20school%20football">football</a>, <a href="basketball">basketball</a>, and <a href="Track%20and%20field%20athletics">track & field</a>. In football, as a senior, he had 698 <a href="Reception%20%28American%20football%29">receiving</a> yards and thirteen receiving <a href="touchdown">touchdown</a>s, and after the season, he was named as an All-District, All-Parish, and All-Acadiana selection. In basketball, he was an All-Parish selection. In track & field, he was a <a href="high%20jump">high jump</a> state champion. Quinten Lawrence graduated from Carencro High School in 2004.
His parents are Wiltion and Laynnette Lawrence.
Toronto Argonauts.
Lawrence was signed by the Toronto Argonauts on June 6, 2013.
